item.title: Programming Your Keyboard
item.description: If you work with enough programmers, eventually you’ll work with a fan of mechanical keyboards. My first mechanical was the Poker II. At the time, I used Vim bindings for programming, in both IDEA and Emacs, and the Poker II is a great keyboard for Vim fans. It features a 60% layout, the backtick key is mapped to escape, and it’s programmable. You can reprogram many of the keys and key combinations as well as program simple macros into the keyboard.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a software developer who lives in New York City. Internet Presence Github Software I Like Emacs React Clojure C NixOS Closure Tools PostgreSQL Ion

item.title: Voxel Engine
item.description: I built a Minecraft clone twice. WebGL Voxel Engine A browser-based voxel engine made with ClojureScript and WebGL Demo Source WebGL Voxel Engine Rewrite A browser-based voxel engine that uses ammo.js Demo Source
